hackathon-description-text: Carleton College is pleased to announce the first large-scale hackathon at a small liberal arts college, bringing the inclusive liberal arts perspective to the world of hackathons. Whether you have a passion for graphic design or a penchant for systems, your skills and ideas can help create something truly powerful. That’s the essence of the liberal arts perspective—diverse backgrounds can lead to impressive results.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: MLH medals, Qiqqa 3 year premium subscriptions for 5 people on the team and Dell Venue 8 tablets for the team and a special gift from CarlHacks!
MLH medals, Qiqqa 3 year subscriptions for 5 people on the team and a special gift from CarlHacks!
MLH medals, Qiqqa 3 year subscriptions for 5 people on the team and a special gift from CarlHacks!
One team will receive a Build Your Own Website The Right Way Using HTML & CSS book for each team member, and $500 of Ragic credit for the team.
The best hack that uses Pebble watches (some are provided in the hardware lab) will receive Pebble Steels.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=Three Oaks Drive, Northfield, MN 55057, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Is the hack more than just another generic social/mobile/local app? Does it do something entirely novel, or at least take a fresh approach to an old problem?
Is the hack practical and something people would actually use? Does it fulfill a real need people have?
Is the hack usable in its current state? Is the user experience smooth? Does everything appear to work? Is it well designed?

hackathon-location-address: Three Oaks Drive, Northfield, MN 55057, USA
hackathon-description-header: Hundreds of students. 36 hours. Limitless possibilities.
